channel.title: I need urgent help ! please fast!
channel.description: I need help changing the reward you get for theiving. My players on my server are getting quick and easy 1m every 15 seconds! How do i change what you get for thieving? IM USING PI! HELP QUICK PLEASE

item.title: I need urgent help ! please fast!
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:

You are basically taking the player’s thieving level and multiplying it by 950, and giving that sum in gold.

Change

to

and change

Now edit all stalls using this method’s method from something like this

to

The new integer is the amount of gold the player recieves from that stall.[/quote]

Something was telling me that multiplier was the problem, although I didn’t want to say because I wasn’t sure.

item.title: I need urgent help ! please fast!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

You are basically taking the player's thieving level and multiplying it by 950, and giving that sum in gold.

Change
[code]public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) {[/code]
to
[code]public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level, int amount) {[/code]

and change
[code]c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950);[/code]
to
[code]c.getItems().addItem(995, amount);[/code]

Now edit all stalls using this method's method from something like this
[code]Thieving.stealFromStall(1187, 120, 10);[/code]
to
[code]Thieving.stealFromStall(1187, 120, 10, 5000);[/code]
(just an example)

The new integer is the amount of gold the player recieves from that stall.

You are basically taking the player’s thieving level and multiplying it by 950, and giving that sum in gold.

Change

to

and change

to

Now edit all stalls using this method’s method from something like this

to

(just an example)

The new integer is the amount of gold the player recieves from that stall.

item.title: I need urgent help ! please fast!
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

MediaFire

Z-FileSearcher.jar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Thats z-file searcher, it’s searches all the files in a folder or where ever, place that in a folder with all your classes OUT of their folders in that folder.

So pretty much… do this.

New folder
Copy source
taken copied source classes and empty all them into new folder
put z file searcher into the new folder
double click and open z file searcher
search 995 and then the money thieve amount. Goodluck!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Nope, still don’t see anything that’s related to the amount thieved. Strange, maybe it’s some weird anti-leech; but the amount is def in their.

And something in my gut tells me something fishy about this line.
c.getItems().addItem(995, npcThieving[j][3]);

Do you have any classes called similar to clicking buttons, object handler, etc?
If you can’t find anything like the above, use Z-file searcher and search the exact amount of GP thieved. Best way to do this is make a copy of your source, place it in a new folder and take all of the classes out of the folders and search with Z-file searcher for the specific amount.

Read full topic

item.title: I need urgent help ! please fast!
item.dc:creator: @ston3 ston3
item.description:
@ston3 wrote:

Um, here is my complete thieving.java codes idk if its any help, if not ill get some more thiev-related codes

package server.model.players.skills;

import server.Config;
import server.util.Misc;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.Server;

/**

  • Thieving.java
  • @author Balla_

**/

public class Thieving {

private Client c;
	
public Thieving(Client c) {
	this.c = c;
}

public void stealFromNPC(int id) {
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2000)
		return;
	for (int j = 0; j < npcThieving.length; j++) {
		if (npcThieving[j][0] == id) {
			if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= npcThieving[j][1]) {
				if (Misc.random(c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] + 2 - npcThieving[j][1]) != 1) {
					c.getPA().addSkillXP(npcThieving[j][2] * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving);
					c.getItems().addItem(995, npcThieving[j][3]);
					c.startAnimation(881);
					c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
					c.sendMessage("You thieve some money...");
					break;
				} else {
					c.setHitDiff(npcThieving[j][4]);
					c.setHitUpdateRequired(true);
					c.playerLevel[3] -= npcThieving[j][4];
					c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
					c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis() + 2000;
					c.sendMessage("You fail to thieve the NPC.");
					break;
				}
			} else {
				c.sendMessage("You need a thieving level of " + npcThieving[j][1] + " to thieve from this NPC.");
			}
		}		
	}
}

public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) {
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2500)
		return;
	if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) {
		if(Misc.random(12) == 1) {
			c.sendMessage("You get caught trying to thieve the stall..");
			c.startAnimation(3679);
			if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) {
				appendHit(Misc.random(4), c);
			} else {
				appendHit(Misc.random(10), c);
				return;
			}
		}
		c.sendMessage("You attempt to steal something from the stall...");
		c.getItems().addItem(id, 1);
		c.startAnimation(832);
		c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950);
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving);
		c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
		c.sendMessage("You steal a " + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".");
		}		
	else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) {
		c.sendMessage("You need a theiving level of "+level+" to theif from this stall.");
	}
}

public static void appendHit(int damage, Client c) {
	Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].setHitDiff(damage);
	Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].playerLevel[3] -= damage;
	c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
	Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].setHitUpdateRequired(true);	
	Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].updateRequired = true;		
}	
//npc, level, exp, coin amount
public int[][] npcThieving = {{1,1,8,200,1},{18,25,26,500,1},{9,40,47,1000,2},{26,55,85,1500,3},{20,70,152,2000,4},{21,80,273,3000,5}};

}

item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

[quote=“ston3, post:7, topic:441451”]I’m currently using Torvapkz v1. Thank you for not trolling, being rude xD Lol. And yes there is actionhandler.java here is the line for it

break;
		case 4878:
			c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1613, 170, 90);
		break;

i dont want to mess around witth the numbers, but does that help at all?[/quote]

No problem, I’m not a troller, I’m more kind hearted lol.

Yeah but that line doesn’t have anything to do with the amount.

This is what that line means:

Case 4878 is the object ID
Then it’s telling the system to fetch the player and thieving methods to steal from the stall. Now for this string (1613, 170, 90); I have NO idea what the hell those numerics are for. My guess earlier was those were either the coords or position, but that’s not possible. Is their anything else in your files that are thieving related?

		case 4878:
			c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1613, 170, 90);
		break;

item.title: I need urgent help ! please fast!
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

[quote=“ston3, post:5, topic:441451”][quote author=DannyIsSoPro link=topic=544148.msg3988513#msg3988513 date=1336254938]
Sigh

Find a folder in your source called skills, or either find a class named thieving or something.

Then look for a method that has the object id for the stand or whatever the object you thieve is. Then find a string that gives the player a certain amount of cash. Search 995 to find that.
Lastly, to change them from thieving every 15 seconds, find the timer somewhere in that method and change it of course.

PS: If you really can’t go through ALL the files in your source before hosting it, I’m sad to say you’re a leecher.

Also, check this out. http://www.freejavaguide.com/corejava.htm
This is where I picked up all my knowledge in Java.

[/quote]I tried doing that, it isn’t there. I went into thieving.java. There is no object ID 4878 (Scimitar Stall) in thieving.java. There is a "getitem().additem 995, but there also is not amount of how much it gives. here is the line

public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) {
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2500)
		return;
	if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) {
		if(Misc.random(12) == 1) {
			c.sendMessage("You get caught trying to thieve the stall..");
			c.startAnimation(3679);
			if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) {
				appendHit(Misc.random(4), c);
			} else {
				appendHit(Misc.random(10), c);
				return;
			}
		}
		c.sendMessage("You attempt to steal something from the stall...");
		c.getItems().addItem(id, 1);
		c.startAnimation(832);
		c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950);
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving);
		c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
		c.sendMessage("You steal a " + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".");
		}		
	else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) {
		c.sendMessage("You need a theiving level of "+level+" to theif from this stall.");
	}
}[/quote]

Haven’t worked with PI for a while, but anyways, I believe their is something in Player.java or in a file called Actionbuttons.java that has to do with the amount received. Yet I don’t know why the amount given isn’t in that method. What source are you using? I’ll take a look through it.

Read full topic

Then look for a method that has the object id for the stand or whatever the object you thieve is. Then find a string that gives the player a certain amount of cash. Search 995 to find that.
Lastly, to change them from thieving every 15 seconds, find the timer somewhere in that method and change it of course.

PS: If you really can’t go through ALL the files in your source before hosting it, I’m sad to say you’re a leecher.

Also, check this out. http://www.freejavaguide.com/corejava.htm
This is where I picked up all my knowledge in Java.[/quote]I tried doing that, it isn’t there. I went into thieving.java. There is no object ID 4878 (Scimitar Stall) in thieving.java. There is a "getitem().additem 995, but there also is not amount of how much it gives. here is the line

public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) {
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2500)
		return;
	if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) {
		if(Misc.random(12) == 1) {
			c.sendMessage("You get caught trying to thieve the stall..");
			c.startAnimation(3679);
			if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) {
				appendHit(Misc.random(4), c);
			} else {

				return;
			}
		}
		c.sendMessage("You attempt to steal something from the stall...");
		c.getItems().addItem(id, 1);
		c.startAnimation(832);
		c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950);
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving);
		c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
		c.sendMessage("You steal a " + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".");
		}		
	else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) {
		c.sendMessage("You need a theiving level of "+level+" to theif from this stall.");

}
